item.title: Remembering Villa Deste: A Slice of Old-World Glamour on Vintage Las Vegas Strip
item.description:
A Refined Escape from the Neon Glow

The 1960s and 70s Las Vegas was synonymous with glitz, glamour, and gambling. But nestled just off the bustling Strip, offering a serene alternative to the casino chaos, stood Villa Deste Restaurant and Lounge. More than just a place to eat, it was an experience â€“ a meticulously crafted blend of classic Italian hospitality and the signature sparkle of Las Vegas. Forget the bright lights and frantic energy; Villa Deste was a sanctuary of rich reds, dark woods, and the gentle glow of candlelight.
